title: Senior Network Automation Engineer
content:
At GFiber, we believe in the power of great internet that lets people do more, helps communities get stronger and makes amazing things possible. We’re not just growing to build better internet experiences, we’re also building a welcoming place where people who want to make a difference can grow their careers.
GFiber is an Alphabet company that brings Google Fiber and Google Fiber Webpass internet services to homes and businesses across the United States. Our growing, inclusive team is expanding as we connect more cities and people. The Network Reliability Engineering team is responsible for building, maintaining, and automating our infrastructure at scale. As a member of the team, you have a direct impact on design and feature enhancements to keep our infrastructure running smoothly. As a member of a Dev/Ops team - you also ensure that network operations are highly reliable and efficient. Google Fiber's network generates a constant stream of challenges which require you to continually be innovative with an evolving set of technologies. Keeping the network reliable ensures that our customers stay always-on and connected to our suite of services.
Role Description
Write, deploy, and maintain software to automate complex operational tasks and telemetry across our suite of infrastructure and services.
Test and evaluate emerging technologies and platforms for possible integration within GFiber’s OSS stack..
Create system level and detailed designs, and curate useful documentation.Provide on-call support of Google Fiber's Automation ecosystem.
Design and implement integration of home-grown tooling with commercial  third party systems and tools.
Develop specialty and ownership of specific domain(s) within our extensive tool suite.
 
In this role, you'll:
Experience in Dev/Ops; writing, testing, deploying, and supporting automation code (Python, Go, Java, etc).
Experience supporting an ISP network - MPLS, ISIS, BGP, IP telephony, enterprise services.
Domain expertise in protocols, network management, automation, data analysis.
Experience with cloud native infrastructure (Google Compute, AWS, Azure, Salesforce, etc).
Experience with  product ownership and development within cross-functional teams
Strong written and oral communication with the ability to influence others with your stellar engineering solutions.
 
At a minimum we'd like you to have:
BA/BS degree in EE/CS/CE or equivalent practical experience.
4 years of networking experience, preferably within service provider vertical.
6 years of software development and automation experience in large networks.
Experience working with EMS tools and software development frameworks.
 
It's preferred if you have:
Experience in Dev/Ops; writing, testing, deploying, and supporting automation code (Python, Go, Java, etc).
Experience supporting an ISP network - MPLS, ISIS, BGP, IP telephony, enterprise services.
Domain expertise in protocols, network management, automation, data analysis.
Experience with cloud native infrastructure (Google Compute, AWS, Azure, Salesforce, etc).
Experience with  product ownership and development within cross-functional teams
Strong written and oral communication with the ability to influence others with your stellar engineering solutions.
 
 
The US base salary range for this full-time position is between $139 K - $203 K + bonus + equity + benefits. As pay varies by location, your recruiter will share more about the specific salary range for your targeted location during the hiring process.
 GFiber is committed to equal opportunity employment regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, citizenship, marital status, disability or Veteran status. Disclosure is voluntary, and this information will be kept confidential in compliance with Google's Candidate Privacy Policy. For more information please refer to our Equal Employment Opportunity Policy and the EEOC's "Know your rights: workplace discrimination is illegal" (PDF). 
It's important to us to create an accessible, inclusive workplace for everyone. If you have a need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing our accommodations for applicants form. Our candidate accommodations team will then connect with you to confidentially discuss your options.
